title: Repeated crashes on trying to open Thunderbird.
content:
I'd really appreciate any help you can give me.

I've been using Thunderbird for many years.

TB has been working fine for all those years. and I have probably thousands of emails stored. Then, I went on a trip Sep 28 to Oct 14 and did not use Thunderbird for about 17 days. On my return, I tried to open TB. I found that a screen opened that I hadn't seen before, and TB seemed to be loading. While loading, at the bottom of the screen it said "Checking inbox for new messages...". Then, after a while it crashed without ever opening.

I tried to open TB several times after that, and I've always gotten the same behavior -- ending with a crash and never being able to open TB.

During the loading once, I clicked on Help >AboutThunderbird, which showed 115.3.3.(32-bit) and "Downloading Update 2.4 of 5.4 MB."

The last four Crash Reports, all dated 10/31/2023 are (the last one being the latest): bp-e634fd35-1b8a-488a-a9df-c23050231101 bp-73858652-569e-4362-95d6-030490231101 bp-992529bf-d1af-41d9-a438-43c370231101 bp-c39563fd-bca7-406f-8abf-85bde0231101

I thank you very much for your assistance. D. Prerau --prerau@rcn.com

title: Uspořádání zpráv podle data a příznaku přečtení - pozice posuvné lišty vpravo
content:
Dobrý den, po přechodu na verzi Supernova se změnilo chování Thunderbirdu. Zobrazujeme si zprávy seřazené podle data a podle příznaku přečtenosti SHORA DOLŮ, správný stav viz přiložený obrázek. Po nastartování Thunderbirdu nebo přechodu do jiné složky zpráv (levý sloupec) vždy chceme, aby Thunderbird zobrazil aktuální nepřečtené zprávy v dolní části seznamu a starší a přečtené zprávy byly zobrazené nahoře nad nimi. Aktuální verze Thunderbirdu sice zprávy správně seřadí, ale posuvnou lištu vpravo neumístí na spodní, ale na horní okraj a nebo někam doprostřed a my na obrazovce nevidíme aktuální nepřečtené zprávy, ale staré a přečtené a musíme pak vždy myší chytit posuvník vpravo a posunout ho do dolní pozice. Vzhledem k intenzivní práci s emaily musíme tuto operaci provádět každých několik minut, co je velmi otravné.

Starší verze si pamatovala toto nastavení a zobrazovala aktuální zprávy na odpovídajícím místě, tak jak je na přiloženém obrázku, i když jsme přecházeli TB vypnuli nebo přecházeli mezi složkami.

title: Supernova 115*  How to reduce the spacing in the Message Header area.
content:
The 'Message Header' is the area above where the message content of an opened email is displayed. It typically contains a set of buttons - Reply, Forward, Archive, Junk, Delete and More It shows From, To, Subject and Date It may show other information depending upon settings and type of email.

Do you find the spacing between eg: the 'From' line and the 'TO' line is too much? Do you want to reduce this gap? If yes, then the following information may solve your problem.

title: Can't remove email account from Thunderbird
content: There is an email account profile on my Thunderbird email program and I simply cannot get rid of it. I have tried everything including running the program as an administrator and nothing works. None of the instructions to remove an email account anywhere on this forum works. When I go into the account settings, there absolutely no selection for me to remove a particular email account/profile from Thunderbird. I have removed Thunderbird, wiped out all traces and profiles for Thunderbird, reinstalled Thunderbird and this particular account keeps coming back. I bought a new computer, installed Thunderbird on that, and this particular email account suddenly appears on the new installation on a new computer. I can't get rid of it. I brought both computers to a technician and they scanned for viruses, trojans, etc., etc., etc., and there is nothing there, but this email address account keeps coming back on any computer I have installed Thunderbird, including new computers that are new out of the box. The email account I want to remove is clogged with spam and tying up my internet connection and the ISP (Charter Communications) will not help me by eliminating this particular email account. I have followed multiple instructions I have found on this forum about how to remove an unwanted email account from Thunderbird and not a single one works because the selection to do this does not exist in Thunderbird. All I get is asked for a password for the email address that the ISP says doesn't exist, but it is being flooded with hundreds of thousands of emails that get sent to this email address in my Thunderbird program. Every time I run Thunderbird, it locks into this particular account and downloads emails until my hard drive is full and crashes. Is there a way to get rid of this email account on Thunderbird or do I just remove the whole program from my computer and use something else?

title: Falha ao enviar mensagem
content:
Olá, bom dia / boa tarde,

Recentemente foi instalado o Thunderbird em um desktop com Windows 10 Pro, e foram adicionadas três contas de email, sendo duas do "Gmail" e uma do "Outlook". As configurações de conexão foram feitas automaticamente.

Todos os emails chegaram chegaram normalmente à caixa de entrada, porém não é possível enviar mensagem por qualquer das três contas. É notificada a seguinte mensagem: "Falha ao enviar mensagem. A mensagem não foi enviada porque a conexão com o servidor de envio (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com falhou. O servidor pode está indisponível ou recusando conexões SMTP. Verifique se as configurações do servidor de envio (SMTP) estão corretas e tente novamente."

Foram verificadas as recomendações na página de suporte da Mozilla, quer verificando as configurações do servidor de saída SMTP, se está sendo usado o servidor SMTP correto, quer se o "firewall" poderia estar bloqueando a porta de saída (o "firewall" está desativado"), quer se padrões de envio seguro estão interferindo, mas o problema ainda persiste.

A versão do Thunderbird é a 115.4.1 (64 bits), e algo que, talvez, possa interferir, seja: como não se tem acesso ao privilégio de administrador do sistema, o local de instalação escolhido foi da pasta de usuário. O arquivo de instalação foi do próprio "website" oficial. Isso poderia interferir?

Desde já, agradeço pelo importante auxílio e atenção.
creator: rogerjgamito

title: (Non-obvious) email provider password change problem
content:
There are a lot of questions that start with something like "My email provider has changed my password" or "I've changed my password" - and where do I tell Thunderbird my new password?

I had to change my Yahoo mail password and couldn't see where to put the new password, and so ended up here. A lot of the questions include a response/solution from David provides a list of steps , which are fine for outgoing (SMTP) mail password, which may or may not be the same.

Then Matt, a moderator and Top 10 contributor has provided a "chosen solution" which starts out "This is a perennial question, and one I really find quite odd."

I'm not a Thunderbird power user, but I'm technically capable. The fact that I had to come here to find out what to do suggests that the "Perennial question" is because the app/help/documentation is inadequate. Also posting the same cut-paste answer isn't actually helping, especially as hollisthomases points out, it's missing an important step, or at least was for me and yahoo.

As hollisthomases points out, you have to close Thuderbird and re-open it. At that point I was asked to re-authenticate Thunderbird to Yahoo. There seems to be no way to trigger this action otherwise.

Can I suggest that 1. The documentation/help needs to be updated 2. The Thunderbird app needs a way to re-drive authentication that doesn't involve closing and restarting the client.

I know that much of Thunderbird is volunteer led. I can't code, or rather, won't. But I'm up for updating or suggesting changes to documentation.

Thoughts or comments?
creator: m_cathcart

title: Message Filters
content:
Just downloaded the latest version and set it up on my two Apple systems. A 2020 M1 MacBook Pro, and an Intel 2014 Mac mini. Did the install/setup on the MacBook Pro first and ended up adding a few message filters per this information: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/blocking-sender

I'm now in the process of setting up the Mac mini, and rather than redoing the message filters wondering if there is a specific file in the Thunderbird profile that I can copy over to the Mac mini that would make both machines have the same message filter settings?
creator: Homer712

title: Can't Right-Click Open Context Menu in SAVED EMAILS unless Thunderbird Client is Also Open
content:
Hi:

I've had this problem ever since Thunderbird did its big update several weeks ago - the one that changed ALL the icons of my saved emails to a newer, plainer, blue/white icon.

I'm currently using Version 115.4.1 (32 bit) Supernova, and "Thunderbird is up to date".

As my Subject title states, ever since this update, I can no longer right-click inside the body of a saved email and bring up any sort of context menu - which means I can't right-click "Copy" text/pics from a saved email...

...unless I open the actual Thunderbird client, and THEN the right-click context menu (and "Copy") becomes available in saved emails!

Why?

Before the update, I could copy text from a saved Thunderbird email without restriction (something I do often for reference when composing emails on other email clients, e.g., Outlook, which I archive by sending them to my desktop hard drive and thus saving them as Thunderbird emails).

As another point of reference, I can still save text/pics in a saved Thunderbird email even when the Thunderbird client is not open... but ONLY by using Ctrl-C or Edit >> Copy. Because right-click is disabled!

[I just discovered this fun fact, BTW. That is, I opened a saved Thunderbird email. I can't get a right-click context menu at all. I then close the email and open my Thunderbird client. When I open that same saved email again, NOW I can right-click and get a context menu. You can actually go back and forth, depending on whether the Thunderbird client is open or not!]

This was never the case before.

Is there any way I can get my right-click context menu (for copying) back so I can use it on saved emails even when my Thunderbird client ISN'T open?

It's a minor thing, but I find myself now right-clicking A LOT in saved Thunderbird emails, and nothing happens!

Anyway, thanks for reading all this,

Todd
creator: ToddRental
